Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2009 02:23PM Eagle713 wrote: Oh juliarose- I can't say how happy I am for you too- I was following your posts because I had excisional done on Monday. I just can say that I'm so glad I'm in a smaller town, I got my news in 54 hours (last night at 8pm the surgeon's nurse called me to let me know my papilloma was benign also.) It doesn't seem right that some are so personally involved with their patients (I feel very blessed after reading all the long waits) and to others we are just another case...  My best to you- we can celebrate this weekend in spirit!
Posts.Title: To all the wonderful people on this board juliarose flash

Posts.Content: Oct 3, 2009 04:04PM Eagle713 wrote: Hi- Hopefully you found some relief since your post. I don't know if I can help, but I do still hurt even 2 weeks later- I'm out just 2 weeks from my excision, and it was about 5 inches around the nipple- so the arm pain wasn't bad. When I had post op appoint. last week, I "complained" of the shooting pain that was like electricity through my breast. He said to take Motrin, and it really did help. I started feeling better and stopped, but just the last few days, I've got all that pain back again, so, back on the Motrin. I hate meds, so it's really hard for me to justify taking them. I also had (have left over) Darvocet sp?, but stopped that about 3 days post op.  I was also surprised that the excision made my boob look flat, the nipple is still there, but flat. Kind of a shock to think it might always be like that... but as we were discussing the shower, I'm thankful for now, that's all we had to deal with. I didn't have a drain, but do wonder if I should have, as there are big lumps under my breast that hurt... guess that's the blood that collected. Take it easy- I have a job that's flexible, so I was able to sit and do no lifting- for about a week I bossed everyone else around and let them push things around for me. I also have 3 newly drywalled rooms to paint and have no ambition at all to do it, so called for a painter today. What the heck, if it hurts, it hurts, and I'll treat myself this time. (I LOVE TO PAINT, so you know I would be doing it if I felt like it!) So, again, take it easy if you can and let yourself heal.
Posts.Title: duct excision/biopsy yesterday - severe pain whatisthis sheila1951

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2009 08:43AM Eagle713 wrote: Hi Momcat! I know exactly how you feel- I've have lumps all over my breasts for 30 years, and never did my GP have any concern. I did the yearly mammos, but for the most part wouldn't know if I had a real bc lump. Last month I started with the orange discharge, that got the ball rolling, and had my mammo, US and St. Biopsy all within 2 weeks. All B9. But still the discharge, so won't be surprised if the surgeon does the duct removal (BTW- he said any color, even blue is possible- but still no "one" color will predict for sure). My GP ordered the whole thing, so I didn't have a problem with insurance (exept I hadn't reached my $5000 deductable until the US). But I'm sure there are others who will respond that there's no way to predict what the lump is until it's biopsied. Try to start with a call to the GP and maybe they can just start an "emergency" ball rolling?  My best to you- and like they say- 80% are B9- so just keep praying for now. Nothing else is in our control.
Posts.Title: My History..please, any help? Momcat1962 Momcat1962

Posts.Content: Sep 8, 2009 08:26PM Eagle713 wrote: Cupid.... I, too just got back with papilloma results....this is what happened to me... May- bloody discharge from my nipple... biopsy with benign cyst aspiration.... followup in 3 months...  3 months later.... I just got back from a 3 month followup from my ster. biopsy of cyst. Nipple discharge was orange then.... still discharging, but slightly lighter color. Well, surgeon got the fluid, said, "much better", then did the ultrasound and said, hummmm.....  Long story short, he saw a "papilloma" this time with small pulsation of a line to it (he said blood supply). There are 2 spots now inside the papilloma, one pin point and the other 2 mm. I am amazed at the center here in my little town, as everything is done very quickly. He asked when would I like to have the excision, I said how soon would you do it? He said Friday or Monday? I said Monday. Wow, talk about crazy. I'm very comforted by his explanation, and he's extremely happy that it was found so soon. He said that the 10,000 some biopsies he's done in 30 yrs (?) only about 300 were this early and only 1 ended up being cancer 3 years later. So, in answer to one of the threads someone had a few days ago about removing a papilloma even if it's not cancer, i understand that we are extremely blessed. We got the warning with the discharge and many don't. So... onward.... I'll be keeping all in my prayers.
Posts.Title: waited for biospy and got result today (papilloma) cupid104 Eagle713

Posts.Content: Sep 11, 2009 04:06PM Eagle713 wrote: newday1976: I am being very optimistic, I know.... there's always the 20% chance it is. I'm just trying to get through the next step (hopefully last) without ativan-lol! I'm like most, prepare for the worst and hope for the best! And after reading so much here, even though he said no need for the MRI, I may just ask again- just met my deductible for the year, so might as well use the insurance that I've paid for for 30 years and never used much.

Posts.Title: bloody nipple discharge amybrown MTwoman

Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2009 05:32PM Eagle713 wrote: Another B9! Yea! Just got news from my excisional biopsy on Monday-  the "papilloma" and everything removed was benign!  Let's all keep reporting the good news as well- I know it helped me when I read that others were in the 80%. And like juliarose- I now have an entirely new perspective on breast cancer and it's fighters.... you all have my highest respect for the information you share and trials you go through to share with us. I've learned so much in 4 months, and I will "stay here" to encourage and support the next person who has to be scared by this demon.
Posts.Title: bloody nipple discharge amybrown MTwoman

Posts.Content: Jun 11, 2009 03:35PM Eagle713 wrote: I'll be watching for your progress and pray for the best for you! I've still got faith in my surgeon (he is the contributing editor for breast cancer on Medpedia.com) so I'll give him the three months, then we'll see what happens?
Posts.Title: bloody nipple discharge amybrown MTwoman

Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2009 03:20PM Eagle713 wrote: Hi all- I've been up to head in business (it's wedding season- and that's what we do- flowers). My appointment yesterday with surgeon left me with this explanation: the fluids are coming from a possible plugging of ducts due to pre-menopause. He will check again in 3 months or sooner if fluids come more frequently. He suggested I take Vitamin E to help keep the ducts "open". He also asked me if I had hay fever, because this could also be a reason for the discharge? Has anyone ever heard of this? Even with the B9 report, this all can still be unsettling. Not to mention that I've become addicted to these boards!
Posts.Title: bloody nipple discharge amybrown MTwoman

Posts.Content: Jun 19, 2009 06:51PM Eagle713 wrote: Hi all- Mamamari- just checking in to find out how your results turned out. Been thinking about you. My discharge continues, just an oily orange. I have my annual pap next week, so I will ask her what she thinks now that the biopsy test is in B9. I'm betting on the duct going before summer's up. Nikkie- I'll ask about the  ductal lavage too. For now- have a good weekend- tomorrow I'm covering chairs for a 450 person wedding (then tear down at midnight tomorrow night) YUCK!
Posts.Title: bloody nipple discharge amybrown MTwoman

Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2009 08:26PM Eagle713 wrote: So--- I, too, have been "lurking" for 3 weeks, amazed at this wonderful sisterhood, half scared, then learning that I don't need to be- since there's all this information and such. Just thought I'd get a step ahead and sign up because.... here's my story: 3 weeks ago, yellow-orange discharge from left breast, sore and only 4 weeks until my mammo. Called doctor and she got me into mammo and US early. Took the normal week to get this info- a formal report from the clinic that everything was fine and to make an appointment in a year. Nurse called back and Dr. wants me to see our surgeon. June 2 (tomorrow) I will visit him. After all the reading of these boards, I became a little worried that our little town, and the surgeon would not give the peace of mind I need. Then I Googled his name and found him to be on the "contributing editors" list at MEDIPEDIA- under breast cancer. That has relieved my mind a little, but hubby is ready to take off for Mayo if I'm not happy.  Anyway- I just wanted to come from my "lurking"- you are all so amazing- and I have learned things I'd never known if I hadn't had this scare. I don't have family history of bc, only an aunt with bone cancer, and grandma with stomach cancer. I don't even have any close friends with any type of bc experience. That's why, when I read the boards about stupid things people say, it really made me think. If nothing else, I feel thankful I've read those and hope I'm better at communicating than those "stupid" ones! LOL! Love you all- already! Eagle
Posts.Title: bloody nipple discharge amybrown MTwoman

Posts.Content: Jun 2, 2009 03:43PM Eagle713 wrote: Back from a whirlwind- went in for surgeon consultation, came out with 2 cysts, aspirated one, biopsied the other. All in the privacy of the office. 3 samples to be sent away for reports. Both look harmless- so will wait until Friday for results. When I asked about the quick service, he laughed and said, "that's the advantage of small hospitals- we can do things quickly". So, all I can say is even though it took me by surprise, it was probably a good thing. No time to worry- and even though the biopsy was very uncomfortable for a few seconds, it's not too bad. The major sized boob patch made my hubby think it was bigger than it is (the incision) I'll let him pamper for today! And the local hasn't worn off yet, so I'm sure I'm in for a little soreness. Guess that's it for now- my best to everyone else undergoing procedures- lot's of us today!
Posts.Title: bloody nipple discharge amybrown MTwoman

Posts.Content: Jun 11, 2009 02:34PM Eagle713 wrote: LynneB- I can't stop smiling, thinking about your response- I, too went to Disneyland when I was 10! Now I'm 54, but did breastfeed, so I guess there goes that theory. I also forgot to mention that the surgeon also said if it continues (which it hasn't since the biopsy and aspiration) he would do ductal excision too. For now, I think I will try the vitamin E, as I don't take anything supplemental, and I did find in google that it might help with fibroid pain. Mama- you, too, are making me giggle! I might not be able to do a maxi- maybe a mini tho!  Nikkie- what did you find out about hyperplasia? That was on mine too.... Well, here's hoping we can all get to the bottom of this mess- I'm in and out alot this weekend- have a safe and peaceful one!
Posts.Title: bloody nipple discharge amybrown MTwoman

Posts.Content: Jun 25, 2009 02:15PM Eagle713 wrote: Mamamari- oh, I'm so sorry I didn't get to a computer for 3 days? I hope you are doing ok. Please know I am praying for you. As the rest of the gals here seem to have all the right words, I feel very very inadequate in the comfort area. Now what is your next step? As everyone seems to say- just take each step as it comes.  My annual exam was uneventful- doctor said she'd be very comfortable with the surgeon's Dx- and just wait the 3 months to see if discharge continues. Oh well....
Posts.Title: bloody nipple discharge amybrown MTwoman

Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2009 05:53PM Eagle713 wrote: Just got my call a day early- Yeah! B9 also! Just wanted to post to let the newbies know that it's not always bad news. It's a scary wait, along with some scary tests, but I've been almost pain free, only 1 Motrin and no bruising from Biopsy. I'm almost back to full activity today (2 days post). Thanks Amy and LynneB for the posts- I was a day behind you with procedure, so it was great to hear your thoughts. Good luck to you all!
